intro.title: Introduction
intro.description: Choosing a character in the cafeteria. Scene 1 of all characters.

actors.name: tom
actors.text: Hey, I’m Tom. Some people like me, but some people are haters. Whatever. It doesn’t matter to me either way.

actors.name: freddie
actors.text: My name’s Freddie. But, don’t call me Fred, and we’ll be cool.

actors.name: janelle
actors.text: I’m Janelle. I love hangin' out with Jay and Desiree, but you probably don’t know them. You seem ok, though. Maybe we could hang out.

actors.name: announcerBox
actors.text: Welcome to Newbridge. Please, choose a character.

help.text: Roll your cursor over the characters to hear their stories. Click a character to choose him or her.

gtfs.text: You'll be notified when it's time to learn some facts about bullying.

games.text: Sometimes you can choose this icon to play another game within the school day.

messages.text: When you have a text message waiting, this is how you read it. This phone only receives texts, though. You can't send any.

videos.text: You'll be directed when to watch videos about bullying. Click this icon when told to see a video on your phone.

actors.name: announcerBox
actors.text: Good morning, students. Today marks the beginning of Stop Bullying Week at Newbridge Middle School. First period starts in two minutes.

actors.name: ross
actors.text: Talk to Ross.

help.text: What would you say to a friend who was making fun of something they know nothing about? Be confident. You can’t control other people’s actions, but you can be true to yourself.

gtfs.text: You'll be notified when it's time to learn some facts about bullying.

games.text: Sometimes you can choose this icon to play another game within the school day.

messages.text: When you have a text message waiting, this is how you read it. This phone only receives texts, though. You can't send any.

videos.text: You'll be directed when to watch videos about bullying. Click this icon when told to see a video on your phone.

choice_01_01.description: Hey [Player character name]. Have you seen all this junk today about bullying and stuff?

choices.text: Yeah. They have this character called Zink the Zebra.
There were a bunch of posters in my homeroom about respect.
It’s about anti-bullying. There’s a whole campaign about it.
This is serious. You shouldn't judge just cuz you don't know about it.
It can't hurt, though. We might even get out of class.
For real. Aren't you gonna be late?
I know, right? Why don't they just send all the losers to another school?

choice_01_02.description: Take it easy. I just wanna know more.
choice_01_02.text: Take it easy. I just wanna know more.

choice_01_05.description: I’m puttin’ up my own stuff: 'Losers go home'.
choice_01_05.text: I’m puttin’ up my own stuff: "Losers go home".

choice_01_06.description: Yeah, we can name it Newbridge School for Exceptional Losers.
choice_01_06.text: Yeah, we can name it Newbridge School for Exceptional Losers.

actors.name: announcerBox
actors.text: Hope you’re having a great day. Just a reminder: your fellow students are important. Stand up for someone who’s not being treated right.

actors.name: mandy
actors.text: Talk to Mandy.

actors.name: augustine
actors.text: Ms Augustine is writing on the white board.

help.text: Have you ever talked about someone behind their back? People sometimes get picked on because of the way they look, or their social status. It can do a lot of damage to gossip about someone, or to spread rumors.

choice_02_01.description: You know that Zink character? I think that new girl has a picture of that zebra on her backpack!

choices.text: Yeah. I think I’ve seen that.
You mean that girl that transferred here?
I’ve seen her around. She’s really quiet.

dp2.description: mandy question wording depends on answer...

choices.text: I don’t know her, but I heard she had a hard time before.
I’ve never talked to her. She seems alright.
What does she expect here? People are definitely gonna mess with her.
I heard she freaked out on some kid and he had to go to the hospital!

choice_02_02.description: Really? Maybe I’ll ask her about it. She could be cool.
choice_02_02.text: Really? Maybe I’ll ask her about it. She could be cool.

choice_02_03.description: You think? I guess I could talk to her.
choice_02_03.text: You think? I guess I could talk to her.

choice_02_06.description: For real? I gotta tell Marcus at lunch.
choice_02_06.text: For real? I gotta tell Marcus at lunch.

actors.name: mandy
actors.text: You've already talked to Mandy.

actors.name: augustine
actors.text: Talk to Ms. Augustine.

help.text: Have you ever talked about someone behind their back? People sometimes get picked on because of the way they look, or their social status. It can do a lot of damage to gossip about someone, or to spread rumors.

choice_03_01.description: Good morning, [Character 1 name]. Are you ready for our class discussion about sexual harassment?

choice_03_02.description: You should have read the handout I gave you yesterday. Sexual harassment is a kind of bullying that involves unwanted sexual attention.
choice_03_02.text: You should have read the handout I gave you yesterday. Sexual harassment is a kind of bullying that involves unwanted sexual attention.

choices.text: Like saying nasty things about people?

choice_03_03.description: Well, unwanted attention could mean calling people by sexually-offensive names, but it also includes making comments about someone’s body, talking about someone’s sexual behavior, and touching or forcing a person to do sexual things.
choice_03_03.text: Well, unwanted attention could mean calling people by sexually-offensive names, but it also includes making comments about someone’s body, talking about someone’s sexual behavior, and touching or forcing a person to do sexual things.

choices.text: What am I supposed to do about it?
I’ve seen that stuff go on sometimes.
Am I supposed to be on the lookout or something?

choice_03_04.description: Whatever you do, don’t ignore it. That won’t make it stop. And if you’re the victim, remember that it’s not your fault. For starters, make it clear that you don’t want to be treated that way. Then tell an adult about it.
choice_03_04.text: Whatever you do, don’t ignore it. That won’t make it stop. And if you’re the victim, remember that it’s not your fault. For starters, make it clear that you don’t want to be treated that way. Then tell an adult about it.

choices.text: I think I get it now.

actors.name: mandy
actors.text: You've already talked to Mandy.

actors.name: augustine
actors.text: You've already talked to Ms. Augustine

help.text: Have you ever talked about someone behind their back? People sometimes get picked on because of the way they look, or their social status. It can do a lot of damage to gossip about someone, or to spread rumors.

actors.name: announcerBox
actors.text: Hi there, Highlanders! Here’s a helpful nugget of wisdom: when it comes to communicating, keep it clean. Respect your neighbor!

actors.name: computer
actors.text: Click here to log into my-face- tube.net.

help.text: A lot of people don’t think it’s a big deal to make fun of people online, but what about the victims? They might start avoiding other people altogether, or post mean comments back, or worse yet, seek revenge in real life. Millions of people use web-based devices. Be careful what you say and share online.

help.text: If you’re being bullied, don’t physically fight back. If it feels safe, stand up to the person. Keep it simple, and try to stay calm. Bullies like it when you get mad. It shows them they’re having an effect on you.

actors.name: announcerBox
actors.text: When a student places materials on the wall, they are altering school property without permission. Bullying does not make us happy campers, and neither does vandalism.

actors.name: cafeteria_letter
actors.text: Read this letter.

help.text: Do you know someone who needs help, but you feel scared, guilty, or powerless to do anything? Lots of people feel that way – some are even scared to come to school in the morning. Think about ways you can change your school environment. Try to find out about your school’s anti-bullying rules.

messages.text: Hey $character_2$, this is Zink. If someone claiming to be a friend is really mean sometimes, and insults or hurts your feelings but always says they're joking, are they a true friend? Accidental hurt feelings happen between friends but continuing to be hurtful and disrespectful is what is called being 'frenemies'.

videos.text: You'll be directed when to watch videos about bullying. Click this icon when told to see a video on your phone.

actors.name: announcerBox
actors.text: We’re pleased as punch to announce that Newbridge will host a play about diversity at the end of Stop Bullying week. Auditions will be this afternoon!

actors.name: carrie
actors.text: Talk to Carrie.

help.text: Most people hesitate to speak out because it can be hard. It takes confidence to stand up for someone being bullied. But chances are the other students witnessing the bullying behavior feel as uncomfortable as you do.

choice_06_01.text: Hey. I didn’t think anyone hung out here.

choices.text: You’re Carrie, right? Did you post that letter?
Are you Carrie? What’s up with that zebra patch you wear?

dp6.description: carrie question wording depends on answer...

choices.text: It’ll get better. From now on, we can hang out.
People act like fools here sometimes.
You should try out for the play.
Just act normal. More people will like you.

choice_06_03.text: I know. Maybe I’ll see you around.

choices.text: That’s why people don’t pick on me.

choices.text: Why is bullying such a problem?
What can I do to help?

dp7.description: zink question wording depends on answer...

choices.text: Doing the play stuff sounds fun. I’m in.
I could help if anyone asked me.
I’m just trying to take care of myself.

choice_07_02.text: Thank you! Your comments have been logged.

actors.name: announcerBox
actors.text: Have you ever found yourself picking on someone else? Well, maybe you could schedule some time to talk to someone about it.

actors.name: augustine2
actors.text: Talk to Ms. Augustine.

help.text: Have you seen bullying in your school? Report it to an adult. There’s a big difference between snitching and telling. Adults can guide you and help you come up with solutions. And remember, telling an adult about a problem that worries or harms you is not the same as snitching on someone else. When your safety and health are at stake, an adult needs to know!
